intro: Pimpinella heyneana, commonly known as the Indian cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. It has a taproot system and is known for its aromatic, slightly bitter leaves. Pimpinella heyneana is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
